name: szenariendb_gwp
title: Global warming potentials from IPCC Assessment Reports
description: This table holds global warming potentials (GWP) published in the IPCC Assessment reports. Due to legal aspects this table currently only holds a subset gases of all published GWPs. The subset was chosen to the gases most related to energy modeling.

sources.title: Climate Change: The IPCC Scientific Assessment
sources.description: Report Prepared for IPCC by Working Group 1

sources.title: Climate Change 1995: The Science of Climate Change
sources.description: Contribution of Working Group I to the Second Assessment Report of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change

sources.title: Climate Change 2001: The Scientific Basis
sources.description: Contribution of Working Group I to the Third Assessment Report of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change

sources.title: Climate Change 2007: The Physical Science Basis
sources.description: Working Group I Contribution to the Fourth Assessment Report of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change

sources.title: Climate Change 2013: The Physical Science Basis
sources.description: Working Group I Contribution to the Fifth Assessment Report of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change

contributors.title: Lukas Emele
contributors.comment: Collection of data from IPCC assessment reports

fields.name: greenhouse_gas
fields.description: Name of the greenhouse gas given as common name, chemical name and/or industrial abbreviation

fields.name: gas_group
fields.description: Gas group as mentioned in the respective IPCC Assessment Report. Attention: The gas groups are not harmonized across the various IPCC Assessment Reports!

fields.name: chemical_formula
fields.description: Chemical formula of the respective greenhouse gas

fields.name: ipcc_report
fields.description: Source of the GWP value. AR1 meaning the First Assessment Report, AR2 the second Assessment Report etc.

fields.name: source
fields.description: Source table within the respective IPCC Assessment Report

fields.name: time_horizon
fields.description: Time horizon for which the GWP of a greenhouse gas was calculated. If unsure: a time horizon of 100 years is most commonly used.

fields.name: global_warming_potential
fields.description: Global warming potential of a greenhouse gas

fields.name: inequality_sign
fields.description: For some gases the Assessment Reports can only give lower or upper limits of the GWP values. In this case this column provides information whether the GWP is below or above a specific value.

_comment.dates: Dates and time must follow the ISO8601 including time zone (YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss±hh)
_comment.units: Use a space between numbers and units (100 m)
_comment.languages: Languages must follow the IETF (BCP47) format (en-GB, en-US, de-DE)
_comment.licenses: License name must follow the SPDX License List (https://spdx.org/licenses/)
